Event.0: U.S. President Barack Obama signed legislation to repeal Don't Ask, Don't Tell, the policy regarding the service of homosexuals in the military; it took effect the following year.
Event.1: Repeal of the "Don't Ask Don't Tell policy", a 17-year-old policy banning homosexuals serving openly in the US military, signed into law by President Barack Obama
Event.2: "Grey's Anatomy" actress Sandra Oh (35) divorces Oscar-winning Sideways director Alexander Payne (45) due to irreconcilable differences after 5 years of marriage
Event.3: British Islamist militant Richard Reid attempted—by trying to ignite explosives hidden in the soles of his high-top basketball shoes—to blow up an airplane on which he and some 200 other passengers were traveling; he was restrained by other passengers, and a U.S. court later sentenced him to life without parole.
Event.4: Lech Wałęsa sworn in as Poland's 1st popularly elected president
Event.5: The Constitution of the Republic of Croatia was promulgated, granting such classic civil rights as freedom of speech, religion, information, and association, as well as guaranteeing the equality of nationalities.
Event.6: The Brandenburg Gate in Berlin was reopened, signifying the reunification of East and West Germany.
Event.7: After 23 years of dictatorial rule, Romania ousts Nicolae Ceausescu
Event.8: Nicolae Ceaușescu was ousted after 24 years of dictatorial rule in Romania.
Event.9:
Ralph Fiennes
English actor
was born
Event.10: NFL quarterback Fran Tarkenton (20) weds Anna Elaine Merrell at First Baptist Church in Decatur, Georgia
Event.11:
Jean-Michel Basquiat
American artist
was born
Event.12:
Robin Hugh Gibb
British-Australian musician and singer
was born
Event.13: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill met in Washington, D.C., to discuss World War II.
Event.14: Filmmaker Billy Wilder (30) weds first wife Judith Coppicus
Event.15: "The Mummy" directed by Karl Freund and starring Boris Karloff is released in the US - 1st Mummy horror film
Event.16: Biologist Alexander Fleming (34) weds Sara McElroy
Event.17:
Lady Bird Johnson
first lady of the United States
was born
Event.18:
Alfred Dreyfus sentenced to life in prison
On this day in 1894, on the basis of specious evidence and anti-Semitism, French army officer Alfred Dreyfus was sentenced to life in prison for treason, sparking a controversy that divided France for 12 years.
Event.19: United States Golf Association forms in New York
Event.20: Claude Debussy's first orchestral masterpiece "Prélude à l'apres-midi d'un faune" premieres in Paris
Event.21:
Srinivasa Ramanujan
Indian mathematician
was born
Event.22: Itō Hirobumi, a samurai, becomes the first Prime Minister of Japan
Event.23: Thomas Edison's phonograph is announced by Scientific American
Event.24: Frank B. Kellogg, U.S. secretary of state from 1925 to 1929 who negotiated the Kellogg-Briand Pact of 1928—a multilateral agreement designed to prohibit war as an instrument of national policy—and won the Nobel Prize for Peace in 1929, was born.
Event.25: Supposedly impenetrable Turkish fortress of Izmail stormed and captured by Suvorov and his Russian armies during the Russo-Turkish War (1787–92)
Event.26: The member states of the Swiss Confederation concluded the Diet of Stans, an agreement whereby civil war was averted.
Event.27: The Dominican order was sanctioned by Pope Honorius III.
